job_title: Inpatient Manager (Registered Nurse) in Monroe, WI
pros: Management and staff were very involved in team building. Great place to work
cons: Distance to work was greater than I desired at the time to keep work/life balance

review_title: Was wonderful before SSM, now, not so much
pros:
I feel like I need to write two reviews here... the first for how it was when it was managed by Monroe Clinic. Mike Sanders (CEO) and Carrie Blum (CIO) were great. The IT department was efficient, fun, and served our customers well. Our customers were defined as:
- the rest of the hospital and clinic employees
- other hospitals using our cloud-hosted Epic

The second review is for Monroe Clinic under SSM (recently rebranded “SSM Monroe”): The “pro” is that the Network Engineering team across the organization is very competent, from a technical perspective, and a pretty friendly bunch.
cons: Too many decisions were made "from a distance" and without proper insight into what the factors truly are. Many edicts were handed down and the whole organization is run from a “This is the way we've always done it” perspective. There were those who tried to drive change, but they were quickly beaten into submission, quit out of frustration (like me), or let go like an old bag of moldy tangerines, even after decades of service.

pros: coworkers are fun to work with

pros: Professional, family like, some employees have been there a long time.  Beautiful new facility! Leadership has a great vision but new ideas  are not well received unless it was their idea..
cons: They sometimes put new coaches or supervisors in new positions with little direction, mentoring or guidance.  They also pile on the committees and workload and burnout their people, really good salaried people who get paid well initially but then work so many hours, extra hours at night to finish projects so their per hour wage drops way down.  Meetings scheduled after meetings all day long, then you have to do your work at the end of the day or at home.

review_title: The worst place I have worked for
cons:
Hard to get time off due to insufficient staffing (even when notice was a year in advance) 
No work-life balance
Poor communication 
No rationale for changes
Negative management
Bully culture
Expensive benefits
Low pay

pros: Great co workers, decent benefit package. Nice new hospital and building new clinic buildings. Not really much more to say.
cons: Too many "coaches" (managers). If they have enough time to babysit provider schedules, have too much time on their hands. Management makes decisions about specific employees tasks without employee input. HR and Coaches seem to conspire against employees. Management does nothing to help with low employee morale. Employees are just a number to this place. Making employees take time off because they cannot make budget. Once again a factor of the micromanagement and having too many "coaches".  If you do disagree with management you are told that it is inappropriate and they do not let you voice your opinion without the feeling of some sort of reprimand. Lack of flexible schedules, seem to set to shift work hours.

review_title: Needs major improvement with Mangement and Human Resource.
pros: The providers and most of coworkers are wonderful to work with. Learned a lot from providers that I have worked with over the years.
cons: Top heavy in the management department. I have seen a lot of good employees terminated for made up reasons just because they are not liked. A lot of bullying going on and coaches, directors and Human Resource are no help at all. Human Resource is suppose to be a place where employees can go when they need help when the coaches fail the employee, but it is not. Patient Care is not #1, and it's sad to see this.
